SEARCH
Package com.simulation.model

Class SimulationEngine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
com.simulation.model.SimulationEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class SimulationEngine extends Thread
Core discrete-event simulation engine for cloud computing service queue simulation.

This class extends Thread and implements a discrete-event simulation (DES) engine that models a cloud computing service provider. The simulation processes tasks through a series of service points:

  1. Data Storage
  2. Classification
  3. CPU/GPU Compute
  4. Result Storage

The engine uses an event-driven approach where events are scheduled and processed in chronological order. Tasks flow through the system based on their type (CPU/GPU) and user priority (Normal/Personal VIP/Enterprise VIP).

Thread Safety: This class is thread-safe for concurrent access from UI thread. The simulation runs in its own thread and uses synchronized methods in ServicePoint and SimulationResults for thread-safe data access.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Cloud Simulation Team

    • SimulationEngine

      Parameters:

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • setListener

      public void setListener(SimulationEngine.SimulationListener listener)
      Sets the listener for simulation events.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to receive simulation updates, or null to remove listener

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(double speed)
      Sets the simulation speed multiplier.

      The speed multiplier controls how fast simulation time advances relative to real time. A value of 1.0 means 1 simulation second = 1 real second. A value of 2.0 means simulation runs twice as fast.

      Parameters:
      speed - the speed multiplier (clamped between 0.1 and 100.0)

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the simulation engine.

      This method resets the clock, clears all events, resets statistics, and schedules the first arrival event. Must be called before starting the simulation.

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the simulation is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if simulation is running, false otherwise

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused()
      Checks if the simulation is currently paused.
      Returns:
      true if simulation is paused, false otherwise

    • pauseSimulation

      public void pauseSimulation()
      Pauses the simulation execution.

      The simulation thread will wait until resumeSimulation() is called.

    • resumeSimulation

      public void resumeSimulation()
      Resumes a paused simulation.

      This method wakes up the simulation thread if it's waiting due to pause.

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation execution.

      The simulation will finish processing the current event and then stop. The thread will exit after completing current operations.

    • stepForward

      public void stepForward()
      Executes a single simulation step when paused.

      This method processes the next event in the queue. Only works when simulation is paused. Useful for debugging or step-by-step execution.

    • getResults

      public SimulationResults getResults()
      Gets the simulation results.
      Returns:
      the SimulationResults object containing all statistics
